div.head: For stampings to embellish and encrust or cover the edges of mirrors, the tops of chests, or the friezes of bed valances
div.ab: Etch with aquafortis on iron or copper whatever you have pounced and drawn there, next clean it up with a burin or chisel. Then pour soft tin which has not been used onto polished marble & with a wooden board, flatten it quite thin. Or else cast it in tablet form like lead, or put it through a roller press. Next lay your tin plate over the etched thing, & over the tin plate put a piece of felt and strike on top with a hammer. Then gild it in this way.
